Successfully assigned ringtone to: About Ringdroid
Use Ringdroid to edit MP3, OGG, WAV, AAC, and AMR audio files and create ringtones, alarms, and notifications from them.\n\nTip: copy audio files to your SD card using a USB cable.\n\nTip: tap anywhere on the waveform to start playing at that position.\n\nTip: while playing, tap the word Start or End to quickly set the start and end markers to the current playback time.\n\nVersion %s\n\nDeveloper: Dominic Mazzoni, Nicolas Faralli\nGraphics: Joseph Wain\nSupport and evangelizing: Eugene Koh\nEnhancements: Dan Klufas\n\nRingdroid is free software, distributed under the Apache 2.0 license. Source code is on github.com/google/ringdroid\n Home
About YouP3 pratimdevonplay@gmail.com This application is only to be used for personal purposes. Please read the TOS Section. YouP3 is licensed under the terms of Apache 2.0 license.\n Application logo,status logos and theme logos are copyright of the developer.Additionally, some icons have been distributed under the CC-BY 4.0 license and are copyrighted by Google, Inc.\n\nNavBar Cover Art by developer\n License Disclaimer http://github.com/exploitr/youp3 http://exploitrme.wordpress.com Copyrighted by ExploiTR / Apache 2.0 TOS As written in Youtube Terms of Service,\n\n"You shall not download any Content unless you see a “download” or similar link displayed by YouTube on the Service for that Content.You shall not copy, reproduce, make available online or electronically transmit, publish, adapt, distribute, transmit, broadcast, display, sell, license, or otherwise exploit any Content for any other purposes without the prior written consent of YouTube or the respective licensors of the Content. YouTube and its licensors reserve all rights not expressly granted in and to the Service and the Content." [Source: https://www.youtube.com/static?template=terms ( goto section 5B)].\n\nSo, You are violating Youtube TOS while downloading and saving media content from youtube offline. The developer isn\'t intended to do that and doesn\'t support that, and takes NO responsibility for what you do using YouP3. Exit Settings Fullscreen Mode Remove Toolbar Downloads No Downloads Sample Name Desktop Mode (beta) 5 MB WYSN : Basic Mode uses WebView API(s), and it uses a normal API which is written to work in this way. It may be unstable, can\'t bypass ads, provides only AUDIO files (mp3) but normally doesn\'t fail anyway. WYSN : Advanced Mode uses a library which also depends on a library which depends on - How Google writes YouTube\'s \'JavaScript(s)\'. So, though it provides options to download much type of video/audio(s) it can fail. Also, it\'s written by third-party, so support also can be stopped from them.
